question:
You recently attended a meeting at a hotel. When you returned home, you found you had left some important papers at the hotel.
Write a letter to the manager of the hotel. In your letter
say where you think you left the papers
explain why they are so important
tell the manager what you want him/her to do
text: Good day, I hope you are doing well.
I am writing to you regarding my recent visit to your hotel, as I have attended a meeting yesterday in the conference room.

Unfortunately, I have forgotten to collect some important papers along with my belongings before leaving. I believe I have left them in the reception area as I decided to have a cup of coffee after a long day of work discussions.

Relevantly, these documents are very crucial to my work as they contain sensitive information that are not supposed to be seen by anyone. I have kept them in a sealed case with a biometric access mechanism.

On the other hand, I would really appreciate if you could search for the case in the reception area as I have been predicting. However, if you cannot find it there, then it might be in the large ground hall where the meeting was held. Also, I would be really thankful if you can contact me with the updates on this matter as soon as possible.
Thank you a lot in advance.
